abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            sustainability likely, and institutional development impacts
            substantial. Positive lessons highlight, and reinforce that
            precise, and realistic goals, clearly reflecting the
            Government's will to higher education reform,
            characterize chances for success, entrusted by government
            officials in the sustained implementation pace. Moreover,
            the sound analytical preparation, and policy consultations
            facilitated implementation, and achievement of development
            objectives, to in addition, prod readily business
            partnerships due to the specificity of project structures.
            Such partnerships also succeeded in part, because the type
            of training offered by the Higher Institutes of Technology,
            met the needs of both public and private enterprises,
            offering a common factor in technological advancement.
            Furthermore, this type of training considerably improves the
            academic standards of higher education. Nonetheless,
            negative lessons point at the weak consultation, and
            information process with stakeholders, which could have been
            improved, had prudent assessment of political risks been
            undertaken prior to reform implementation. And if the
            Government expects to maintain those educational reforms
            that succeeded, it will be crucial to invest in long-tem
            gains, rather than in seeking short-term political benefits.
